isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 530 Engine Diagnostic Manual for 4000 Series Trucks (2001) - ENGINE CONTROL SYSTEM OVERVIEW - VEHICLE FEATURES - Standard Features

svcsubproc.title: Electronic Governor Control
svcsubproc.para: INTERNATIONAL DT 466 and DT 530 engines are electronically controlled for all operating ranges.

svcsubproc.title: American Trucking Association Datalink Provisions
svcsubproc.para: Vehicles are equipped with the American Trucking Association (ATA) datalink connector for communication between the ECM and the Electronic Service Tool (EST).
The datalink provides communication capabilities for the following:

item.para: Production line programming of vehicle features

svcsubproc.title: Service Diagnostics
svcsubproc.para: The electronic service tool provides diagnostic information for the Master Diagnostics (MD) Software.

DTC's for sensors, actuators, electronic components, and engine systems are detected and stored in the ECM. The ECM transmits DTC's to the EST to assist with diagnostic action. The ECM also provides DTC's emitted by the engine.

svcsubproc.title: Electronic Speedometer and Tachometer Provisions
svcsubproc.para: The engine control system calibrates vehicle speed to 157,157 pulses/mile. Dip switches no longer need to be changed when components affecting speed calibration are changed. However, the new speed calibration information must be programmed with an Electronic Service Tool.

The tachometer signal is generated by the ECM by computing the CMP signal. The result of this calculation is transmitted to the instrument dash cluster via the J1939 Datalink and the EST via the ATA Datalink.

svcsubproc.title: Engine Over Temperature Protection System (Coolant Temperature Compensation)
svcsubproc.para: Coolant Temperature Compensation reduces fuel delivery if engine coolant temperature is above the cooling system specifications. Fueling is reduced proportionally to the design limit exceeded. Fuel reduction is calibrated to a maximum of 40% before standard engine warning or optional warning/shutdown is engaged. If warning or shutdown occurs, a Diagnostic Trouble Code is stored in the ECM memory.

note.para: Coolant Temperature Compensation may be omitted on emergency vehicles that require 100% power on demand.

svcsubproc.title: Event Logging System
svcsubproc.para: The event logging system records engine operation above maximum rpm (overspeed), high coolant temperature, low coolant level, or low oil pressure. This information and readings for the odometer / hourmeter are stored in the ECM memory and may be accessed using the EST.

svcsubproc.title: Engine Crank Inhibit
svcsubproc.para: Engine Crank Inhibit will not allow the starting motor to crank if the engine is running or the automatic transmission is in gear. Engine Crank Inhibit (ECI) is an optional system for vehicles with manual transmissions.

svcsubproc.title: Electronic Accelerator Pedal
svcsubproc.para: The Electronic Accelerator Pedal eliminates the mechanical linkage used with conventional accelerator pedals. An accelerator position sensor, part of the accelerator pedal assembly, provides the ECM with an analog voltage signal representing the driver's demand for power.

svcsubproc.title: Cruise Control
svcsubproc.para: Cruise Control regulates vehicle speed using automotive style, on/off, set/accel buttons. Speed control is disabled when the service brakes are applied, the clutch pedal is depressed, or the automatic transmission is placed in neutral. The accelerator pedal can be used to increase speed from the selected cruise speed.

svcsubproc.title: Cold Ambient Protection (CAP)
svcsubproc.para: The CAP system safeguards the engine from damage caused by prolonged periods of idle at no load during cold weather conditions. CAP also improves cab warm up.

CAP maintains engine coolant temperature by increasing the engine rpm to a programmed value when the Ambient Air Temperature is below 32°F (0°C), the Engine Coolant Temperature is below 149°F (65°C), and the engine has been idling with no load for more than 5 minutes.
CAP is standard on all trucks without an Idle Shutdown Timer, with a clutch switch (manual transmission), or a neutral safety switch (automatic transmission).
